New Records: The Dodgers became the first club in the majors to reach 80 wins
Key Match Events: Blake Treinen escaped a bases-loaded jam in the seventh inning
Evan Phillips picked up his 17th save in a clean ninth
Colton Cowser hammered a 3-and-1 fastball for a three-run homer in the fifth
Pre-Game Insights: Dave Roberts said he wouldn’t be managing the Dodgers any differently this week
Austin Barnes said the team was ‘kind of an older team’ and ‘we’ve been in these situations before’
The Dodgers held Freddie Freeman out of the starting lineup for a third straight game, hoping a series-long break would help ease the discomfort he’s been feeling in his fractured right middle finger
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts said the team showed well and that it’s still good to go out there and find ways to win baseball games
Blake Treinen said the successful homestand shows what the team believed they are as a team
Dave Roberts said he’s pleased with how the team has been playing and just wants to sustain that till the end of the season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers are 17-8 in August, benefiting from a more balanced lineup, the bullpen’s return to form, and just enough production from a banged-up starting rotation
The status of rotation ace Tyler Glasnow remains up in the air, with Roberts stopping short of calling his return from elbow tendinitis a guarantee
